intro: Pittosporum erioloma, commonly known as the silver-leaf pittosporum, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves that often have a silvery underside, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters, typically in spring. These flowers are followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds. Pittosporum erioloma is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
